source: Kansas Office of Veterans Services, VA Kansas City Health Care, VA Eastern Kansas Health Care, Catholic Charities, St Michael's Veterans Center

resources.name: Kansas Office of Veterans Services
resources.address: 700 SW Jackson Street, Suite 701, Topeka, KS 66603
resources.description: State office providing veteran services, housing assistance, employment support, and mental health resources with $12M budget for fiscal 2026

resources.name: Kansas 211
resources.description: Free, confidential information and referrals for community resources including housing, food, health, employment, and veteran services

resources.name: VA Kansas City Health Care - Homeless Veteran Care
resources.address: Kansas City, MO area (serves Kansas veterans)
resources.description: VA center providing homeless veteran care including emergency food and shelter, transitional and permanent housing, job training, life skills, and education

resources.name: VA Eastern Kansas Health Care - Homeless Veteran Care
resources.description: VA center providing homeless veteran care including emergency food and shelter, transitional and permanent housing, job training, and support services

resources.name: Catholic Charities - Veteran Services
resources.description: Housing First model providing permanent housing as foundation for addressing employment, financial, substance abuse, and mental health challenges; SSVF program

resources.name: St Michael's Veterans Center
resources.description: Veterans services center with professional and licensed staff providing employment services and veteran support

resources.name: Benilde Hall - Safe Haven for Veterans
resources.description: Supportive housing for homeless veterans providing safe haven services and wraparound support

resources.name: Kansas Veterans' Home - Winfield
resources.description: State-operated long-term care facility for aged and disabled veterans

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: 24/7 free confidential crisis support for veterans and families experiencing mental health crises, PTSD, suicidal thoughts

resources.name: Vet Centers - Combat Veteran Counseling
resources.description: Combat Veterans eligible for free individual and group counseling at VA Vet Centers

resources.name: Kansas Veteran Support - KanVet.org
resources.description: Online resource for veteran support and services information in Kansas

additional_resources.housing_first_model: Permanent housing is foundational - once achieved, helps overcome other obstacles
additional_resources.house_bill_2007: 2026 budget enhancement for Kansas veteran services
additional_resources.va_benefits: https://www.va.gov/ - Comprehensive VA benefits and healthcare

notes: Kansas has two VA health care regions serving the state (Kansas City and Eastern Kansas). Kansas Office of Veterans Services received $12M budget for fiscal 2026. Call 211 for local resource referrals. Combat veterans eligible for free Vet Center counseling.
